name: Residence Inn Austin Downtown / Convention Center

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Residence Inn a couple of times over the last couple of months and all my experiences have been great. The location of the hotel is perfect for both business and enjoying all the night life that Austin has to offer. The hotel is split down the middle between a Courtyard and the Residence Inn. The rooms on the Residence Inn are nice and spacious. You get a fridge and a microwave. I really like having a fridge. The staff are polite and accomodating. The only negative to the hotel is the cost of parking, but you really have to expect that with a downtown location. This is my go to hotel in Austin.
reviews.title: Great location and a comfortable room

reviews.text: Being right across from the convention center and only two blocks from 6th street puts this hotel in the middle of the Austin action. The room was typical Residence Inn material. I was impressed by the clean windows, often times hotel windows are dirty and nasty to look out through but not here . I am always impressed by front desk staff that can recall names and Susanna was top notch. The valets were quick although a couple of times it took two phone calls to get hold of them. They were helpful with directions and very courteous. Valet parking was $27/night, ouch! This is a repeatable stay if ever back in the Austin area.
reviews.title: clean room, great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: This is an excellent place to stay in Austin. It's basically like having your own flat in Austin, and the location is fantastic. The suites have full sized kitchens, and mine was immaculately clean and very large. I really enjoyed my room. I also swam in the pool (a bit chilly at 74-75 degrees, but fine for swimming laps on my own--it would have been crowded with others trying to do the same thing), and the breakfast spread was diverse and very fresh/tasty for an included buffet. I also appreciated the "free" wifi. The only main complaint I have is that they tried to double charge me for parking, but I caught it before checkout and got it resolved without a problem. I will definitely stay there again when I'm in Austin!
reviews.title: Excellent Place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a studio on the sixth floor, facing sixth avenue. As with all residence inns it has a full kitchen complete with wine glasses (but no corkscrew).
reviews.title: Two blocks from party central in Austin

reviews.text: We stayed here Friday through Monday for the purpose of exploring Austin. The hotel is well situated for that purpose, being downton on fourth street within walking distance of the state capital and many other downtown attractions. Each night of our stay sixth street (two blocks away) was filled with people enjoying the Austin music and bar scene.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: I stayed for 11 days and the staff at this hotel are so nice and helpfull that I'm looking forward to my next trip. Next week. Suzanna at the front desk is absolutely amazing. She should be promoted as a trainer to train any new staff. If each Marriott hotel had a Suzanna, there would be no reason to ever consider staying anywhere else. Also, Katie in the hotel restaurant was awesome, smile every day. Both of these ladies greeted me by name, each time they saw me coming.
reviews.title: A Breath of Fresh Air

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location - right in downtown Austin. You have the choice to self park or valet - both are pretty expensive, but so is anything else in downtown Austin.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Rooms, Great Customer Service & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was VERY easy (I was 3 hours early and they let me check in) and the staff was great.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast here is outstanding - the best breakfast buffet I've seen.
reviews.title: Great Location and Room!

reviews.text: Cookies were also offered in the lobby in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Good On All Counts

reviews.text: $300. for this room was way too high. We booked it with a wedding rate, and were not pleased with the facility. It needed a face lift, and lots of brightening. The breakfast was terrific, and the staff was very eager to please. Parking was higher than advertised, and we never got any Marriott points for our stay.
reviews.title: Great breakfast. Dreary room.

reviews.text: One of the first signs we noticed when checking in was one that said "excessive noise will not be tolerated". And, indeed, the hotel guests were well behaved and quiet. This unfortunately wasn't the case for people outside the hotel. We were on level six and our room faced the river, several blocks away. The noise, we think, was coming from sixth street, two blocks behind us. We could hear people shouting until after 3:00am. In all other respects the hotel was fine and in reality the noise wasn't too bad from inside the room - the insulation is good.
reviews.title: Ok for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Austin is a growing city and, unlike other Texas cities, attempting to create a people friendly downtown. This being the case, you can walk around and find decent cafes and restaurants. On weekends it's quiet (during the day) but its refreshing not to have to drive everywhere. And this hotel's location is fine. It's a short walk to a couple of good coffee shops, the river, and at least one attraction - the state capital. You'll probably want to drive to the university, but it's still relatively close and easy.
reviews.title: Downtown Austin

reviews.text: Got a night on Marriott Rewards points, and this location was good for a night in Austin. Corner room was smallish, but had good views out two sides. Reception was efficient, valet parking was quick ($29.00) and breakfast was excellent! All in all a good stay.
reviews.title: Busy area when conventions in town!

reviews.text: As said before, room was on points, regular weekend rate was $289/night......not worth that much! As a night for free on points, it was an excellent value, though!
reviews.title: Great southern hospitality!!

reviews.text: I stayed here on business and wanted to be close to downtown.
reviews.title: Good location; good staff
Great staff
reviews.text: I was very impressed with the staff here. They were universally friendly. It was a good feature to have the Champions Sports Bar integrated with the hotel. They served the free breakfast, which was above average. The facilities were newer. The room was clean, fairly large and comfortable. The wifi was free and strong.
My only negative was the towels. I rarely comment on towels, but these were way below average; very thin and not soft. The toiletries seemed fairly cheap, as well. Below normal Marriott standards.
reviews.title: excellent location, best breakfast

reviews.text: The location is very handy to the downtown. The valet parking is more costly than advertised, the sign says $26, which is extremely steep for this size of a city.
reviews.title: Great Location & Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was all really wonderful. We stayed over the Christmas holidays and the activities organized for children were great. The breakfast was great. It was nice to have variety in the warm breakfast items, with a combinTion of TexMex. Southern and traditional. Location is good. It just bothers me that guests pay $21/night for parking. Why would you do that?
reviews.title: A real bargain for downtown Austin

aka: Residence Inn Austin Downtown / Hotel Austin
description: The newly-remodeled Residence Inn Austin Downtown/Convention center is in the heart of downtown adjacent to the Convention center and within walking distance of the famed 6th Street and Warehouse Entertainment District. Guests love this ideal location with easy access to all of Austin’s favorite destinations including the State Capitol and the University of Texas. The remodeled lobby features trendy designs and comfortable seating areas in the Gatehouse that are perfect to catch up with family and friends. Guests also love the onsite dining options including Champions Sports Bar & Restaurants serving over 25 draft beers as you watch the big game on their 24 HD TVs, and also the Starbucks Café which offers delicious sandwiches, pastries, and their signature coffee. The renovated, apartment-stryle Guest rooms are 50% larger than a standard hotel guest room and offer luxury Queen beds, flat-screen TVs, separate living and dining areas, and full kitchens with refrigerators, stovetops, and microwaves. Guests enjoy free WiFi, an indoor pool, and rooftop terrace offering stunning downtown Austin views.
